titleStmt.title: The Birds reported from the South --

publicationStmt.p: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Johnson, 1955

lg.l: The Birds reported from the South --
A News express to Me --
A spicy Charge, My little friends --friends -- Posts --
But you must goyou must go I am deaf -- Today --
The Flowers -- appealed -- a timid Throng --
I only sealed Nor I -- Herself -- Our Compact --only sealed Nor I -- Herself -- Our Compact -- reinforced the Door --
Go blossom to the Bees -- I said --
And harassharass trouble Me -- no More --
The Summer Grace, for Notice strove --
Remote -- Her best Array -- The Heart -- to stimulate the Eye
Refused too utterly --
At length, a Mourner, like Myself,
She drew away austere --
Her frosts to ponder -- then it was
I recollected Her --
She suffered Me, for I had mourned --
I offered Her no word --
My Witness -- was the Crape I bore --
Her -- Witness -- was Her Dead --
Thenceforward -- We -- together dwelt --
I never questioned Her --
Our Contract
A Wiser Sympathy
away
